lead_paragraph: PREISS--Henriette Blinder, age 88, passed away peacefully on June 2 with her family in Grass Valley, California. An avid world traveler and a devoted lover of symphony, opera, theater, art and literature, she never stopped reading the New York Times cover to cover every day. A highly respected and published pioneer in the field of teaching children with learning disabilities, she helped hundreds of children. Born and raised in Chicago, Henriette graduated from the University of Chicago. She married Abe Blinder and later married Fredric Preiss, and spent her more recent years with companion Jerome Barrer. Most of her adult life was lived in the Westchester County, NY area. She is survived by her two devoted sons Henry (wife Ruth) and Jon (companion Debbie) Blinder, and granddaughter Hanna; her sister Judith Genesen (husband Louis); as well as her loving step-families and many wonderful and talented nieces, nephews and their children. Henriette possessed a warmth, wit and an insatiable curiosity about the world, which inspires us and which we will always cherish and keep in our hearts. 1/3
